definition: to make/to cause/to enable/to use/to employ/to send/to instruct sb to do sth/envoy/messenger
round/lump/ball/to roll into a ball/to gather/regiment/group/society/classifier for a lump or a soft mass: wad (of paper), ball (of wool), cloud (of smoke)
the Macartney mission to Qing China in 1793
pinyin: Ma3 ga2 er3 ni2 shi3 tuan2

definition: the Macartney mission to Qing China in 1793
pinyin: Ma3 jia2 er3 ni2 shi3 tuan2

sentences.english: The German Emperor took revenge on China by making thinas difficult in the ceremony and propriety.
sentences.chinese: 出於報復心理，德皇在禮儀問題上刁難載灃使團。

sentences.english: George Macartney Diplomatic Corps' visit to China was one of the important events in the relationship between China and Britain in history.
sentences.chinese: 馬葛爾尼使團訪華是中英關係史上的一件大事。

sentences.english: Welcome to the open house of the Chinese Mission.
sentences.chinese: 歡迎大家出席中國駐歐盟使團的“開放日”活動。

sentences.english: From the Macartney Mission to China, western world had begun to pay attention to "DA QING LU LI" or "Laws of Great Qing".
sentences.chinese: 西方社會關注《大清律例》始自馬戛爾尼使團訪華。

sentences.english: From the first, the Jesuits concentrated on foreign missions, education, and scholarship.
sentences.chinese: 從第一，耶穌會集中於外國使團，教育和獎學金。

sentences.english: The  committee admits it  committed an  omission in  commissioning the  mission.
sentences.chinese: 委員會承認它在委任使團時犯的疏忽。

sentences.english: He was knighted in 1514, and employed on various embassies.
sentences.chinese: 他在1514年受封爵士，被任用參與各種外交使團。

sentences.english: Yakunin spent six years as a diplomat at the Soviet mission to the United Nations.
sentences.chinese: 雅庫寧當了6年時間蘇聯駐聯合國使團的外交官。

sentences.english: Her father mobilized a mission to search for the missing girl.
sentences.chinese: 她的父親動員了一個使團去搜尋這個失蹤的女孩。

sentences.english: China will open a permanent mission to ASEAN next year.
sentences.chinese: 中國將於明年設立常駐東盟使團。

sentences.english: Brazil now has more diplomatic missions in Africa than Britain has.
sentences.chinese: 巴西比英國在非洲的外交使團都要多。
